item.title: Irwan add a quote by Viktor Shklovsky
item.description:
"You have to store up books, becoming acquainted with human experience; let them lie around your thoughts, becoming yours—ring upon ring, as a tree grows, let them rise up from the depths like coral islands.
If it gets crowded with all the books and there's nowhere to put your bed, it's better to exchange it for a folding bed" -- Viktor Shklovsky

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "If you are lucky enough to have lived in Paris as a young man, then wherever you go for the rest of your life, it stays with you, for Paris is a moveable feast." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Orhan Pamuk
item.description:
"Over time, I have come to see the work of literature less as narrating the world than "seeing the world with words."
From the moment he begins to use words like colors in a painting, a writer can begin to see how wondrous and surprising the world is, and he breaks the bones of language to find his own voice. For this he needs paper, a pen, and the optimism of a child looking at the world for the first time. " -- Orhan Pamuk

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Hal Abelson
item.description: "There's a good part of Computer Science that's like magic. Unfortunately there's a bad part of Computer Science that's like religion." -- Hal Abelson

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Mark Abley
item.description: "Modern English is the Wal-Mart of languages: convenient, huge, hard to avoid, superficially friendly, and devouring all rivals in its eagerness to expand." -- Mark Abley

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Sapardi Djoko Damono
Irwan add a quote by Sjahrir
item.description: "As a reminder, that sometimes, history gives great enough opportunity to those with ideals and who struggle to test their ability to realize their dreams," -- Sjahrir

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Wiji Thukul
item.description: "Apa gunanya banyak baca buku Kalau mulut kau bungkam melulu" -- Wiji Thukul

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Irwan add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Read, read, read. Read everything -- trash, classics, good and bad, and see how they do it. Just like a carpenter who works as an apprentice and studies the master. Read! You'll absorb it. Then write. If it's good, you'll find out. If it's not, throw it out of the window." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Harold Kushner
item.description: "I think of life as a good book. The further you get into it, the more it begins to make sense." -- Harold Kushner

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Soren Kierkegaard
item.description: "Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced." -- Soren Kierkegaard

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Sam Harris
item.description: "In fact, "atheism" is a term that should not even exist. No one ever needs to identify himself as a "non-astrologer" or a "non-alchemist." We do not have words for people who doubt that Elvis is still alive or that aliens have traversed the galaxy only to molest ranchers and their cattle. Atheism is nothing more than the noises reasonable people make in the presence of unjustified religious beliefs." -- Sam Harris

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Atwood H. Townsend
item.description: "No matter how busy you may think you are, you must find time for reading, or surrender yourself to self-chosen ignorance." -- Atwood H. Townsend

item.title: Irwan add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Richard Hughes
item.description: "Do your bit to save humanity from lapsing back into barbarity by reading all the novels you can." -- Richard Hughes

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Irwan add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "Attention is vitality. It connects you with others. It makes you eager. Stay eager." -- Susan Sontag
